header.title: The Battery Blanket Lifestyle
header.subtitle: Extension cords are the new leash

standard_all.content:
There is a special bond between an Edmontonian and their extension cord. It is an umbilical cord of survival. You snake it across the sidewalk, creating a tripping hazard for the neighbors, just so your engine block doesn't turn into a solid cube of regret.

Driving away with it still plugged in is a rite of passage. That snapping sound is the sound of freedom, followed immediately by the sound of shame.
standard_all.footer: See related: How to fix a severed cord with electrical tape at -30C.

standard_subtitle.content:
The grader came by! The road is smooth! But wait, what is this monolithic barrier across my driveway?

It is the Windrow. A frozen mixture of ice, gravel, and hatred. It weighs as much as a small sedan and requires a pickaxe to dismantle. The city calls it 'efficient clearing.' I call it 'mandatory CrossFit.'

standard_footer.content:
To stay warm at the bus stop requires constant movement. We call it 'The Shiver Shimmy.' You hop from foot to foot, tuck your chin, and vibrate.

It looks like a nervous breakdown, but it is actually a sophisticated thermal regulation technique. We are all just vibrating molecules trying not to freeze in place.

standard_minimal.content:
I saw the sun today. It appeared at 10:00 AM, skirted the horizon like it was afraid of us, and dipped out by 3:30 PM.

We now enter the Long Dark. The time of artificial lights and Vitamin D supplements. Remember the sun? It was nice. We might see it again in May.
